circumstances: The crew was engaged in a local training mission out from Luke Field AFB, Ford Island, Hawaii. While cruising over the airbase at an altitude of 1,200 feet, the aircraft collided with a second Keystone B-4A registered 32-132 and also carrying a crew of four. Both aircraft dove into the ground and crashed near the airfield. Two crewmen on board 32-132 survived while six other occupants were killed.
